DKP3A Kaltim Berikan Pelatihan Orang Tua Menangani Anak Kebutuhan Khusus
07 Nov 2019, 12:22 by Siti Khairiyah


DKP3A Kaltim Berikan Pelatihan Orang Tua Menangani Anak Kebutuhan Khusus

KBRN,Samarinda:Tingginya anak berkbutuhan khusus di Kalimantan Timur, membuat Dinas Kependudukan, Pemberdayaan Perempuan dan Perlindungan Anak (DKP3A) Provinsi Kaltim mengadakan Pelatihan pendamping  bagi orang tua  anak berkebutuhan khusus  di Hotel Grand Viktoria Samarinda Kamis (7/11/2019).
Pelatihan ini dibuka secara resmi Kepala DKP3A diwakili Kepala Bidang Pemberdayaan Perempuan dan Perlindungan Anak Nur Adenany. Usai membuka pelatiahn tersebut Nur Adenany kepada RRI mengatakan, tujuan diadakaknya kegiatan ini adalah sebagai upaya untuk meningkatkan keterampilan dan pengetahuan bagi orang tua  agar dapat memberikan pelayan yang baik bagi anak berkebutuhan khusus terutama di rumah.
“Orang tua bisa memiliki,pengetahuan dan keterampilan bagaimana cara penanganan yang tepat untuk mengoptimalkan tumbuh kembang anak berkebutuhan khusus.” kata Adenany.
Nara sumber yang dihadirkan dalam pelatihan ini yakni Kepala DKP3A Kaltim Halda Arsyad, Indrawati  dari KPPPA Republik Indonesia dan Widarwati dari Sinar Talenta Samarinda. Pelatihan ini juga diikuti sebanyak 40 orang peserta yang terdiri dari 1 orang pendaping sekolah dna 5 orang tua anak berkebutuhan khusus yang ada di Kota Samarinda.

DKP3A East Kalimantan Provides Parents' Training in Handling Children with Special Needs
Nov 7 2019, 12:22 by Siti Khairiyah


DKP3A East Kalimantan Provides Parents' Training in Handling Children with Special Needs

KBRN, Samarinda: The high number of children with special needs in East Kalimantan has made the Department of Population, Women's Empowerment and Child Protection (DKP3A) of East Kalimantan Province conduct a companion training for parents of children with special needs at the Grand Viktoria Hotel in Samarinda on Thursday (11/07/2019).
The training was officially opened by the Head of DKP3A represented by the Head of Women's Empowerment and Child Protection Division, Nur Adenany. After opening the training, Nur Adenany told RRI that the purpose of this activity was to increase the skills and knowledge of parents in order to provide good service for children with special needs, especially at home.
"Parents can have knowledge, skills and how to handle it properly to optimize the growth and development of children with special needs," said Adenany.
Resource persons presented at the training were Head of East Kalimantan DKP3A Halda Arsyad, Indrawati from KPPPA of the Republic of Indonesia and Widarwati from Sinar Talenta Samarinda. The training was also attended by 40 participants consisting of 1 person attending school and 5 parents of children with special needs in the city of Samarinda.
